messages.title: Re-elect Deidre Brock
messages.content: This election is about our future, whether we can escape Brexit and whether we get the chance to move on to a new future. We have already suffered a decade of austerity, we can’t afford the economic and cultural damage that Brexit would cause.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: It's clearer now than it ever was that Brexit would be hugely damaging. We need to find a way out of Brexit to protect our country.
Deidre Brock's contributions to the Environment Audit Committee have been valuable in tackling environmental issues.
Deidre Brock is tackling problems caused by short-term lets, especially party flats.
The campaign for fairness in women's pensions still has a long way to run. The government isn't listening to the problems 1950s women face and that's massively unfair.
Deidre Brock is working to help the creative industries in Edinburgh and Leith by opposing the hostile environment policies of the Home Office.
Deidre Brock has worked on nuclear safety issues and has criticized handling of nuclear incidents.

issues.brexitEurope: It's clearer now than it ever was that Brexit would be hugely damaging.
issues.defence: Worked on nuclear safety issues and criticized handling of nuclear incidents.
issues.economy: Economic costs of Brexit are stark.
issues.health: We need to look to the future - how to guard the NHS against privatisation, how to stop service cuts, how to hire more doctors and nurses, and support them to give us a better NHS.
issues.socialWelfare: Campaign for fairness in women's pensions still has a long way to run.

community.content: Deidre is tackling problems caused by short-term lets, especially party flats.

politicalExperience.achievements: Helped thousands of people who needed help of an MP and supported local groups in finding resources and solving problems.

contactInformation.address: Deidre Brock SNP, 217 Portobello High Street, Edinburgh, EH15 2AN

endorsements.endorsement: Having an MP on our beach clean, and making a real change on a consistent basis, shows she’s hard at work.

endorsements.endorser: Rev Iain May, South Leith Parish Church
endorsements.endorsement: I know and like Deidre. She's smart and hardworking and she's not afraid to take on the system.
Very impressed with her efforts in Parliament for the people of Leith.
Deidre is a great ambassador for Scotland.
Deidre is an excellent MP and I want to keep her.

endorsements.endorser: Simon Barrow, Author and Social Policy Specialist

examples: This election is about our future, whether we can escape Brexit.
We have already suffered a decade of austerity.
Helped thousands of people who needed help of an MP.
Tackling problems caused by short-term lets.
Women's pensions campaign still has a long way to run.
Having an MP on our beach clean, and making a real change on a consistent basis, shows she’s hard at work.
I know and like Deidre. She's smart and hardworking and she's not afraid to take on the system.
Very impressed with her efforts in Parliament for the people of Leith.
Deidre is a great ambassador for Scotland.
Deidre is an excellent MP and I want to keep her.
Economic costs of Brexit are stark and social and cultural costs are being just as plainly demonstrated.

nonPolicyAttributes.localness: Deidre is always ready to lend a helping hand to organizations in need and to support organizations and people in the community.

examples: Deidre is always ready to lend a helping hand to organizations in need and to support organizations and people in the community.
